title: trust
comment: Reliance on and confidence in a person. Scripture affirms the total trustworthiness of God, especially in relation to his promises to his people. Christian faith is, essentially, trust in the person and character of God. While Scripture insists that believers should be able to trust one another, it also provides examples of false or misplaced trust.

children.title: trust, importance of
children.comment: Scripture emphasises the importance of putting one's trust in God. This trust, which is nurtured by an understanding of God's revealed truth, finds expression in a life lived according to his purpose. There are examples in Scripture of proper trust being placed in other people.

children.title: Trust in God's power and strength

children.title: The results of trusting in God

secondaryrefs.comment: In the OT material prosperity is often seen as a sign of the spiritual wealth that belongs to those who trust God
A good wife gives her husband confidence

the gatekeepers appointed by David and Samuel

Timothy to find others to be entrusted to teach the gospel

children.title: Continued trust in those who fail

primaryrefs.comment: God re-appoints Jonah despite earlier disobedience.

seealsos.comment: Jesus Christ reinstates Peter after his denial
Barnabas gives John Mark a second chance.

children.title: trust, lack of
children.comment: Forsaking God and relying on other objects of dependence. This is futile and it provokes God's anger. Failure to trust others may be the result of a betrayal of trust in the past.
